title: Operations with schemas in Creatio IDE
content_markdown:
Version: 8.3
On this page
Level: beginner
The **Configuration** section lets you execute operations with the following schemas:
* configuration schemas
* environment schemas
Learn more: [Schemas overview](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=15347).
Action| UI element for a single action| UI element for bulk actions| Configuration schemas that support the action| Environment schemas that support the action  
---|---|---|---|---  
Add a configuration schema| Items of the **Add** drop-down list in the main workspace| Not available| Object  
Client module  
Source code  
Business-process  
Web service  
User task  
SQL script  
Data| Not available  
Import a configuration schema| **Import** item of the **Add** drop-down list in the main workspace| Not available| All types| Not available  
Search for a schema| **Search** field in the main workspace| Not available| All types| All types  
Filter the schemas by type| Not available| Items of the **Type** drop-down list in the main workspace| All types| All types  
Filter configuration schemas by status| Not available| Items of the **Filters** drop-down list in the main workspace| All types| Not available  
Install the schema into the database| **Install** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| **Install SQL scripts** item of the **Multi actions** drop-down list in the main workspace  
**Install SQL scripts where it is needed** item of the **Actions** drop-down list in the section toolbar| SQL script| Not available  
**Install data** item of the **Multi actions** drop-down list in the main workspace  
**Install data where it is needed** item of the **Actions** drop-down list in the section toolbar| Data| Not available  
Update database structure| **Update database structure** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| **Update objects DB structure** item of the **Multi actions** drop-down list in the main workspace  
**Update DB structure where it is needed** item of the **Actions** drop-down list in the section toolbar| Object| Not available  
Generate source code for compilable schemas| **Generate source code** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| **Generate source code** item of the **Multi actions** drop-down list in the main workspace  
**Generate for modified schemas** , **Generate where it is needed** and **Generate for all schemas** items of the **Actions** drop-down list in the section toolbar| Object  
Business-process  
User task| Not available  
Sort the schemas| Not available| Column names in the main workspace| All types| All types  
Open the schema properties| **Properties** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| Not available| All types| All types  
Open the schema metadata| **Open metadata** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| Not available| Object  
Client module  
Source code  
Business-process  
Web service  
Case  
User task  
Marketing campaign  
Addon  
Creatio.ai skill| Client module  
Open source code for compilable schemas| **Open source code** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| Not available| Object  
Client module  
Business-process  
User task| Client module  
Edit an object| **Edit process** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| Not available| Object| Not available  
Compile configuration changes| Not available| **Compile** button in the section toolbar| All types| All types  
Compile all configuration| Not available| **Compile all** item of the **Compile** drop-down list in the section toolbar| All types| All types  
Export a schema| **Export** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| **Export** item of the **Multi actions** drop-down list in the main workspace| Object  
Client module  
Source code  
Business-process  
Web service  
Case  
User task  
Marketing campaign  
Addon  
Creatio.ai skill| Not available  
Move a schema to another package| **Move to another package** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| **Move to another package** item of the **Multi actions** drop-down list in the main workspace  
**Move all elements** item of the package menu in the configuration workspace| All types| All types  
Delete a schema| **Delete** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| **Delete** item of the **Multi actions** drop-down list in the main workspace| All types| All types  
Lock schema in the SVN repository| **Lock element in SVN** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| Not available| All types| All types  
Unlock schema in the SVN repository| **Unlock element in SVN** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| Not available| All types| All types  
Discard schema changes in SVN repository| **Discard changes** item of the schema menu in the main workspace| Not available| All types| All types  
## Add a configuration schema​
Creatio lets you add only configuration schemas. Learn more: [Schemas](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/8.x/dev/development-on-creatio-platform/category/configuration-elements).
To add a configuration schema:
1. **Go to the configuration workspace**.
2. **Create or select a package** to add the configuration schema. You cannot add configuration schemas to preinstalled packages.
3. **Click Add** → **select the schema**.
![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/scr_add_configuration_schema.png)
4. Depending on the selected schema, **follow the instructions** : [Schemas](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/8.x/dev/development-on-creatio-platform/category/configuration-elements).
## Import a configuration schema​
Creatio lets you import a schema as an *.md file or a reference assembly as a *.dll file into the user-made package. You can import only one configuration schema at a time. To do this:
1. **Go to the configuration workspace**.
2. **Create or select a package**.
3. **Click Add** → **Import** → **select the file** that implements the schema to add.
Creatio alerts users that the action could potentially degrade environment performance. Out of the box, those messages are enabled only for environments whose **Environment type** (`EnvironmentType` code) system setting is set to "Production."
## Search for a schema​
1. **Go to the configuration workspace**.
2. **Select where to search schemas**. Out of the box, Creatio searches for the schema among both the environment and configuration schemas.
* Select the **Configuration** group to **search both the configuration and environment schemas**.
* Select the **Environment schemas** group to **search environment schemas**.
* Select the **Packages** directory to **search configuration schemas in all packages**.
* Select a package to **search configuration schemas in a dedicated package**.
3. **Go to the main workspace** → **Search field** → **enter the value**.
4. **Set up search mode** (optional).
Search mode| Description  
---|---  
![btn_starts_with.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_starts_with.png)| The schema name or title starts with the text you type in the **Search** field.  
![btn_contains.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_contains.png)| The schema name or title contains the text you type in the **Search** field. Selected by default.  
![btn_equals.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_equals.png)| The schema name or title is the same as the text you type in the **Search** field.  
The search mode is saved to the user profile and applied when you open the **Configuration** section.
**As a result** , Creatio will search schemas in a dedicated package or in all packages based on the selected settings and display the filtered schemas in the **Name** and **Title** columns of the section list.
## Filter the schemas​
**Configuration** section lets you filter schemas by type and by status.
### Filter the schemas by type​
1. **Go to the configuration workspace**.
2. **Select where to filter the schemas**. Out of the box, Creatio filters both the environment and configuration schemas.
* Select the **Configuration** group to **filter both the configuration and environment schemas**.
* Select the **Environment schemas** group to **filter environment schemas by type**. **Environment schemas** group includes the "Client module" type schema only.
* Select the **Packages** directory to **filter configuration schemas in all packages**.
* Select a package to **filter configuration schemas in a dedicated package**.
3. **Go to the main workspace** → **click Type** → **select the schema type**.
![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/scr_select_configuration_schema_type.png)
**As a result** , Creatio will filter schemas by selected type in a dedicated package or in all packages based on the selected settings and display the filtered schemas in the **Type** column of the section list. The settings of the **Type** drop-down list are saved to the user profile and applied when you open the **Configuration** section.
Schema type| Schema  
---|---  
Client module| Freedom UI page  
Module  
Page view model  
Section view model  
Detail (list) view model  
Detail (fields) view model  
Replacing view model  
Object| Object  
Replacing object  
Web service| REST service  
SOAP service  
### Filter configuration schemas by status​
1. **Go to the configuration workspace**.
2. **Select where to filter the schemas**. Out of the box, Creatio filters the configuration schemas only.
* Select the **Packages** directory to **filter configuration schemas in all packages**.
* Select a package to **filter configuration schemas in a dedicated package**.
3. **Go to the main workspace** → **click Filters** → **select the status**.
![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/scr_select_configuration_schema_status.png)
Status icon| Description  
---|---  
![icn_locked.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/icn_locked.png)| The schema is locked and you cannot change it  
![icn_need_actualization.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/icn_need_actualization.png)| The schema must be updated.When Creatio displays the ![icn_need_actualization.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/icn_need_actualization.png) that has the "Needs to be installed in database" tooltip in the **Status** column of the section list, **install the schema into the database**. The status and tooltip are available for "SQL script" and "Data" type schemas only.Install the "SQL script" and "Data" type schemas into the databaseTo **install a single "SQL script" or "Data" type schema** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the "SQL script" or "Data" type schema that has the ![icn_need_actualization.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/icn_need_actualization.png) in the **Status** column.
3. Click ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Install**. This opens a mini page to confirm the action.
To **install multiple "SQL script" type schemas** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the "SQL script" type schemas.
3. Click **Multi actions** → **Install SQL scripts**.
To **install all "SQL script" type schemas** :
1. Go to the section toolbar → **Actions** → **Actualize items**.
2. Click **Install SQL scripts where it is needed**.
To **install multiple "Data" type schemas** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the "Data" type schemas.
3. Click **Multi actions** → **Install data**.
To **install all "Data" type schemas** :
1. Go to the section toolbar → **Actions** → **Actualize items**.
2. Click **Install data where it is needed**.
When Creatio displays the ![icn_need_actualization.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/icn_need_actualization.png) that has the "Needs to be updated in database" tooltip in the **Status** column of the section list, **update database structure**. The status and tooltip are available for "Object" type schemas only.Update database structure for "Object" type schemasTo **update database structure for a single "Object" type schema** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the "Object" type schema that has the ![icn_need_actualization.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/icn_need_actualization.png) in the **Status** column.
3. Click ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Update database structure**. This opens a mini page to confirm the action.
To **update database structure for multiple "Object" type schemas** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the "Object" type schemas.
3. Click **Multi actions** → **Update objects DB structure**.
To **update database structure for all "Object" type schemas** :
1. Go to the section toolbar → **Actions** → **Actualize items**.
2. Click **Update DB structure where it is needed**.
Creatio alerts users that the action could potentially degrade environment performance. Out of the box, those messages are enabled only for environments whose **Environment type** (`EnvironmentType` code) system setting is set to "Production."When Creatio displays the ![icn_need_actualization.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/icn_need_actualization.png) that has the "Needs generate source code" tooltip in the **Status** column of the section list, **generate source code for compilable schemas**. The status and tooltip are available for "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas only.Generate source code for "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemasTo **generate source code for a single "Object," "Business-process" or "User task" type schema** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the "Object," "Business-process" or "User task" type schema that has the ![icn_need_actualization.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/icn_need_actualization.png) in the **Status** column.
3. Click ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Generate source code**. This opens a mini page to confirm the action.
To **generate source code for multiple "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the "Object," "Business-process," and/or "User task" type schemas.
3. Click **Multi actions** → **Generate source code**.
To **generate source code for all modified "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas** :
1. Go to the section toolbar → **Actions** → **Source code**.
2. Click **Generate for modified schemas**.
Creatio alerts users that the action could potentially degrade environment performance. Out of the box, those messages are enabled only for environments whose **Environment type** (`EnvironmentType` code) system setting is set to "Production."To **generate source code for "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas that required it** :
1. Go to the section toolbar → **Actions** → **Source code**.
2. Click **Generate where it is needed**.
To **generate source code for all "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas** :
1. Go to the section toolbar → **Actions** → **Source code**.
2. Click **Generate for all schemas**. This operation might take more than 10 minutes.
Creatio generates the source code for schemas in the background. Learn more: [Execute operations in the background](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=15231).The major features of background generation are as follows:
* Background generation does not affect the core user workflows.
* Starting compilation or a new source code generation is not possible while the running operation is not complete. If you attempt to start these actions, Creatio warns you that the source code generation is still in progress.
* We do not recommend working on functionality that requires compilation until the source code generation is done. That includes installing apps and extensions, configuring the UI and business logic.
When source code generation is finished, Creatio displays the corresponding notification in the communication panel.  
![icn_has_error.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/icn_has_error.png)| The schema contains an error. The status is available for all schema types.Fix the error
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the schema that has the ![icn_has_error.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/icn_has_error.png) in the **Status** column.
3. Click ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Properties**. This opens the **Properties** window that includes the description of the error to fix.
**As a result** , Creatio will filter schemas by selected status in a dedicated package or in all packages based on the selected settings and display the filtered schemas in the **Status** column of the section list. The settings of the **Status** drop-down list are saved to the user profile and applied when you open the **Configuration** section.
## Sort the schemas​
Creatio lets you sort the schemas in the section list in ascending or descending order. Regardless of sorting, Creatio displays the modified schemas at the top of the section list and marks them using ![icn_changed_schema.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/icons/8.2/icn_changed_schema.png).
To sort the schemas:
1. **Go to the configuration workspace**.
2. **Select where to sort schemas**. Out of the box, Creatio sorts the schemas among both the environment and configuration schemas.
* Select the **Configuration** group to **sort both the configuration and environment schemas**.
* Select the **Environment schemas** group to **sort environment schemas**.
* Select the **Packages** directory to **sort configuration schemas in all packages**.
* Select a package to **sort configuration schemas in a dedicated package**.
3. **Go to the section list** → **click the column name**.
## Open the schema properties​
1. **Go to the section list**.
2. **Select the schema**.
3. **Click** ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Properties**. This opens the **Properties** window.
## Open the schema metadata​
1. **Go to the section list**.
2. **Select the schema**. Creatio lets you open metadata of "Object," "Client module," "Source code," "Business-process," "Web service," "Case," "User task," "Marketing campaign," "Addon," "Creatio.ai skill" type of the configuration schemas and "Client module" type of the environment schemas.
3. **Click** ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Open metadata**. This opens a new page that includes schema metadata.
## Open source code for compilable schemas​
1. **Go to the section list**.
2. **Select the schema**. Creatio lets you open source code of "Object," "Client module," "Business-process," "User task" type of the configuration schemas and "Client module" type of the environment schemas.
3. **Click** ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Open source code**. This opens a new page that includes the source code of the compilable schema.
## Edit an object​
1. **Go to the section list**.
2. **Select the "Object" type schema**.
3. **Click** ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Edit process**. The **Edit process** item is displayed only for "Object" type schemas. If the object was created by a third party, this opens a mini page to confirm the action.
**As a result** , Creatio will open a new tab that includes object process.
## Compile the configuration​
**Configuration** section lets you compile only the configuration changes or compile all configuration.
### Compile configuration changes​
Compile only the configuration changes to apply only the latest configuration changes quickly. This option compiles modified schemas only and is recommended after making minor updates to schemas.
To compile only the configuration changes, **go to the section toolbar** → **click Compile**. This opens a mini page to confirm the action.
Creatio alerts users that both actions could potentially degrade environment performance. Out of the box, those messages are enabled only for environments whose **Environment type** (`EnvironmentType` code) system setting is set to "Production."
**As a result** :
* The executable files will be updated.
* The static content will be downloaded to the "..\Terrasoft.WebApp\conf" directory.
* A corresponding notification will be displayed once the compilation finishes.
* The changes take effect for users working in the relevant configuration.
### Compile all configuration​
Compile all configuration to rebuild the entire configuration. This option recompiles all packages and schemas and is recommended after major updates, package imports, or before creating an assembly package.
To compile all configuration, **go to the section toolbar** → **click Compile** → **Compile all**. This opens a mini page to confirm the action.
Creatio alerts users that both actions could potentially degrade environment performance. Out of the box, those messages are enabled only for environments whose **Environment type** (`EnvironmentType` code) system setting is set to "Production."
**As a result** :
* The executable files will be updated.
* The static content will be downloaded to the "..\Terrasoft.WebApp\conf" directory.
* A corresponding notification will be displayed once the compilation finishes.
* The changes take effect for users working in the relevant configuration.
### Handle compilation errors and warnings​
If errors or warnings occur as part of the compilation, Creatio displays:
* The list of compilation errors presents in your configuration in the **Compilation results** window.
* The **Compilation errors** button in the **Configuration** section.
![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/scr_compilation_errors.png)
The button is visible only if your configuration has compilation errors. The error list takes into account both full configuration compilation and compilation of separate assembly packages.
Click the **Compilation errors** button to **check the list of compilation errors**. This opens the **Compilation result** window that includes the list of compilation errors presents in your configuration. Each compilation error has the following parameters:
* The error type icon (error ![](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/default/files/documentation/sdk/ru/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/scr_error_icon.png) or warning ![](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/default/files/documentation/sdk/ru/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/scr_warning_icon.png)).
* "File name" column that includes the name of the file with an error.
* "Description" column that includes the error description.
* "Code" column that includes the error code.
* "Line" column that includes the number of the line with an error.
* The **Compilation error** indicator on the app page.
![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/scr_compilation_warning.png)
The indicator is visible only for users that have the "System administrators" role. **Click the Compilation error indicator** to open the **Configuration** section and fix compilation error(s).
Creatio also saves compilation history that was run manually or automatically to the "CompilationHistory" (`CompilationHistory` code) object. The "CompilationHistory" (`CompilationHistory` code) object includes errors and warnings that occur as part of configuration, OData, or assembly package compilation.
To **view the compilation results** :
1. **Click** ![](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/en/files/images/NoCodePlatform/Manage_Apps/btn_system_designer_8_shell.png) in the top right → **System setup** → **Lookups**.
2. **Create a lookup**.
1. Click **New lookup**.
2. Fill out the lookup properties.
Property| Property value  
---|---  
Name| Compilation history  
Object| Compilation History  
3. Click **Save**.
3. **Open the Compilation history lookup**.
**As a result** :
* The compilation results will be displayed in the "Result" column.
* If errors or warnings occur during the compilation, i.e., the "Result" column is set to "No," any compilation errors will be displayed in the "Errors/Warnings" column.
* The user who started the compilation will be displayed in the "Started by" column.
* Compilation duration will be displayed in the "Duration" column.
![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/scr_compilation_history.png)
## Export a schema​
To **export a single schema** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the schema. Creatio lets you export "Object," "Client module," "Source code," "Business-process," "Web service," "Case," "User task," "Marketing campaign," "Addon," "Creatio.ai skill" type of the configuration schemas only.
The **Export** item is inactive for environment schemas because they cannot be transferred between environments. To transfer customizations stored in an environment schema, convert an environment schema to a configuration schema to transfer the customizations between environments as part of a package. Read more >>>
3. Click ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Export**. This opens the **Save As** window.
4. Select the directory on your device for schema saving.
**As a result** , the schema will be exported as an *.md file.
To **export multiple schemas** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the schemas.
3. Click **Multi actions** → **Export**.
**As a result** , the schemas will be exported as a *.zip archive.
You can install the exported schema(s) into a different environment. Instructions: [Transfer schemas](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=15206).
## Move a schema to another package​
To **move a single schema** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the schema.
3. Click ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Move to another package**. This opens the window to select the destination package.
4. Select the destination package.
To **move multiple schemas** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the schemas.
3. Click **Multi actions** → **Move to another package**. This opens the window to select the destination package.
4. Select the destination package.
To **move all package schemas** :
1. Go to the configuration workspace.
2. Select the package.
3. Click ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Move all elements**. This opens the window to select the destination package.
4. Select the destination package.
Creatio alerts users that the action could potentially degrade environment performance. Out of the box, those messages are enabled only for environments whose **Environment type** (`EnvironmentType` code) system setting is set to "Production." When you move the schema(s), Creatio IDE sets package dependencies automatically.
If you move an environment schema, Creatio populates the "Package" column for the moved schema in the section list.
Dependency conflicts might appear after transferring schemas between packages. To **check for dependency conflicts** :
1. **Go to the section toolbar** → **Actions** → **Configuration**.
2. **Click Validate configuration**. This opens a mini page to confirm the action. The operation might take some time.
Creatio alerts users that the action could potentially degrade environment performance. Out of the box, those messages are enabled only for environments whose **Environment type** (`EnvironmentType` code) system setting is set to "Production."
## Delete a schema​
Creatio lets you delete schemas from user-made packages only.
To **delete a single schema** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the schema.
3. Click ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Delete** or hover over the schema → click ![](https://academy.creatio.com/sites/default/files/documentation/sdk/ru/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/scr_DeleteButton.png). This opens a mini page to confirm the action.
To **delete multiple schemas** :
1. Go to the section list.
2. Select the schemas.
3. Click **Multi actions** → **Delete**. This opens a mini page to confirm the action.
When you delete parent schema for environment schema, Creatio does not delete environment schema. If you re-add parent schema, Creatio continues to apply changes implemented in the environment schema.
## Operations with schemas in SVN repositories (for .NET Framework only)​
### Lock schema in the SVN repository​
To lock the schema from changes in the connected SVN repository:
1. **Go to the configuration workspace**.
2. **Select the schema**.
3. **Click** ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Lock element in SVN**. The **Lock element in SVN** item is active only for schemas installed from the SVN repository.
### Unlock schema in the SVN repository​
To unlock the schema for changes in the connected SVN repository:
1. **Go to the configuration workspace**.
2. **Select the schema**.
3. **Click** ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Unlock element in SVN**. The **Unlock element in SVN** item is active only for locked schemas installed from the SVN repository.
### Discard schema changes in SVN repository​
1. **Go to the configuration workspace**.
2. **Select the schema**.
3. **Click** ![btn_package_menu.png](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/documentation/sdk/en/BPMonlineWebSDK/Screenshots/SectionConfigurationGeneralInfo/8.3/btn_package_menu.png) → **Discard changes**. The **Discard changes** item is active only for schemas whose package is connected to the SVN repository.
* * *
## See also​
[Schemas](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/8.x/dev/development-on-creatio-platform/category/configuration-elements)
[Execute operations in the background](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=15231)
[Transfer schemas](https://academy.creatio.com/documents?ver=8.3&id=15206)
* * *
## E-learning courses​
[Development on Creatio platform](https://academy.creatio.com/e-learning/development-creatio-platform)

tables.html:
Status icon

Description

The schema is locked and you cannot change it

The schema must be updated.

When Creatio displays the that has the "Needs to be installed in database" tooltip in the Status column of the section list, install the schema into the database. The status and tooltip are available for "SQL script" and "Data" type schemas only.

Install the "SQL script" and "Data" type schemas into the database

To install a single "SQL script" or "Data" type schema:

  1. Go to the section list.
  2. Select the "SQL script" or "Data" type schema that has the in the Status column.
  3. Click → Install. This opens a mini page to confirm the action.

To install multiple "SQL script" type schemas:

  1. Go to the section list.
  2. Select the "SQL script" type schemas.
  3. Click Multi actions → Install SQL scripts.

To install all "SQL script" type schemas:

  1. Go to the section toolbar → Actions → Actualize items.
  2. Click Install SQL scripts where it is needed.

To install multiple "Data" type schemas:

  1. Go to the section list.
  2. Select the "Data" type schemas.
  3. Click Multi actions → Install data.

To install all "Data" type schemas:

  1. Go to the section toolbar → Actions → Actualize items.
  2. Click Install data where it is needed.

When Creatio displays the that has the "Needs to be updated in database" tooltip in the Status column of the section list, update database structure. The status and tooltip are available for "Object" type schemas only.

Update database structure for "Object" type schemas

To update database structure for a single "Object" type schema:

  1. Go to the section list.
  2. Select the "Object" type schema that has the in the Status column.
  3. Click → Update database structure. This opens a mini page to confirm the action.

To update database structure for multiple "Object" type schemas:

  1. Go to the section list.
  2. Select the "Object" type schemas.
  3. Click Multi actions → Update objects DB structure.

To update database structure for all "Object" type schemas:

  1. Go to the section toolbar → Actions → Actualize items.
  2. Click Update DB structure where it is needed.

Creatio alerts users that the action could potentially degrade environment performance. Out of the box, those messages are enabled only for environments whose Environment type (EnvironmentType code) system setting is set to "Production."

When Creatio displays the that has the "Needs generate source code" tooltip in the Status column of the section list, generate source code for compilable schemas. The status and tooltip are available for "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas only.

Generate source code for "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas

To generate source code for a single "Object," "Business-process" or "User task" type schema:

  1. Go to the section list.
  2. Select the "Object," "Business-process" or "User task" type schema that has the in the Status column.
  3. Click → Generate source code. This opens a mini page to confirm the action.

To generate source code for multiple "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas:

  1. Go to the section list.
  2. Select the "Object," "Business-process," and/or "User task" type schemas.
  3. Click Multi actions → Generate source code.

To generate source code for all modified "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas:

  1. Go to the section toolbar → Actions → Source code.
  2. Click Generate for modified schemas.

Creatio alerts users that the action could potentially degrade environment performance. Out of the box, those messages are enabled only for environments whose Environment type (EnvironmentType code) system setting is set to "Production."

To generate source code for "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas that required it:

  1. Go to the section toolbar → Actions → Source code.
  2. Click Generate where it is needed.

To generate source code for all "Object," "Business-process," and "User task" type schemas:

  1. Go to the section toolbar → Actions → Source code.
  2. Click Generate for all schemas. This operation might take more than 10 minutes.

Creatio generates the source code for schemas in the background. Learn more: Execute operations in the background.

The major features of background generation are as follows:

  • Background generation does not affect the core user workflows.
  • Starting compilation or a new source code generation is not possible while the running operation is not complete. If you attempt to start these actions, Creatio warns you that the source code generation is still in progress.
  • We do not recommend working on functionality that requires compilation until the source code generation is done. That includes installing apps and extensions, configuring the UI and business logic.

When source code generation is finished, Creatio displays the corresponding notification in the communication panel.

The schema contains an error. The status is available for all schema types.

Fix the error
  1. Go to the section list.
  2. Select the schema that has the in the Status column.
  3. Click → Properties. This opens the Properties window that includes the description of the error to fix.

headings.text: Operations with schemas in Creatio IDE
Open source code for compilable schemas​
Move a schema to another package​
Operations with schemas in SVN repositories (for .NET Framework only)​
Lock schema in the SVN repository​
Unlock schema in the SVN repository​
Discard schema changes in SVN repository​
